Cross-posting from https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29581#issuecomment-1984212990:

The broken change was introduced in [PowerShell 7.3](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/powershell/powershell-7-3-general-availability/#improvement-to-native-command-argument-passing):
> Windows and Linux/macOS have fundamental differences in how native command arguments are handled specifically when quotes are involved. We added a new feature [`$PSNativeCommandArgumentPassing`](https://learn.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/learn/experimental-features#psnativecommandargumentpassing) to control how PowerShell passes arguments to native commands. The default behavior for Windows and Linux/macOS should work as most users expect in their respective environments.

**tl;dr:** Empty strings are preserved as arguments now.

The CI was broken due to the PowerShell [upgrade](https://github.com/actions/runner-images/issues/9115) from 7.2.18 to 7.4.1.
